question: Two trains are moving towards each other on parallel tracks with speeds of 60 km/h and 90 km/h, respectively. If they are initially 300 km apart, how long will it take for them to meet?
A particle starts from rest and accelerates uniformly at 4 m/s². After 5 seconds, it continues to move with constant velocity for 10 seconds. Calculate the total distance traveled by the particle.
A velocity-time graph of a particle moving in a straight line is a straight line passing through the origin with a slope of 2 m/s². What is the displacement of the particle in the first 4 seconds?
A ball is thrown vertically upward with a speed of 20 m/s from the ground. Calculate the maximum height reached by the ball. (Take g = 10 m/s²)
A car traveling at 30 m/s comes to a stop in 10 seconds with uniform deceleration. Calculate the distance covered by the car during this time.
A cyclist travels 10 km at a speed of 20 km/h and then another 10 km at a speed of 30 km/h. What is the average speed of the cyclist for the entire trip?
A particle moves along the x-axis such that its position \( x \) as a function of time \( t \) is given by \( x(t) = 4t^2 - t^3 \). Determine the time \( t \) when the particle comes to rest.
A car is moving in a circular track of radius 100 m with a constant speed of 20 m/s. Calculate the time taken to complete one full revolution.
A particle moves along a straight line with its position given by \( x(t) = 3t^2 - 2t + 1 \). Find the instantaneous velocity of the particle at \( t = 2 \) seconds.

Two cars are moving in the same direction along a straight road with velocities of 60 km/h and 80 km/h, respectively. If the faster car is initially 100 km behind the slower car, how long will it take for the faster car to catch up with the slower car?
A projectile is launched vertically upward with an initial velocity of 50 m/s. Calculate the total time the projectile will be in the air. (Take g = 10 m/s²)

A particle moves along a straight line with an acceleration given by \( a(t) = 6t - 4 \) m/s². If the initial velocity of the particle is 2 m/s, find the velocity of the particle at \( t = 3 \) seconds.
A car travels 100 km at a speed of 50 km/h and then another 100 km at a speed of 100 km/h. What is the average velocity of the car for the entire trip?

A particle moves along the x-axis such that its position \( x \) as a function of time \( t \) is given by \( x(t) = 2t^3 - 5t^2 + 4t - 1 \). Find the instantaneous acceleration of the particle at \( t = 2 \) seconds.
A distance-time graph of a particle moving in a straight line is a parabola given by \( x(t) = 4t^2 + 2t \). Calculate the velocity of the particle at \( t = 3 \) seconds.
